data.job_description:
:

Python Developer in Houston Texas. W2 only. Contract. Hybrid.

Skills:

Python, React, Linux, Unix, API

Additional Skills & Qualifications:

Required Skills-

• Strong development experience using Python, REST API Service

• 3+ years of extensive experience working as a full stack React JS developer (familiarity with redux a plus)

• Database development skills, experience with Object-oriented and Relational databases - SQL Server/Oracle/Sybase.

• Experience developing software using Agile methodology.

• Knowledge of JIRA tools and Continuous Integration capabilities.

• Familiarity with web services, web sockets and microservice based architecture is a plus

• Hands on experience in writing unit and UI integration test cases.

Experience Level:

Intermediate Level

About TEKsystems:

We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.

The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

We are an equal opportunity employers and will consider all applications without regard to race, genetic information, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants with disabilities that require an accommodation or assistance a position, please call 888-472-3411 or email This is a dedicated line designed exclusively to assist job seekers whose disability prevents them from being able to apply online. Messages left for other purposes will not receive a response.

Qualifications: Python, React, Linux, Unix, API
Strong development experience using Python, REST API Service
Database development skills, experience with Object-oriented and Relational databases - SQL Server/Oracle/Sybase
Experience developing software using Agile methodology
Knowledge of JIRA tools and Continuous Integration capabilities
Hands on experience in writing unit and UI integration test cases

data.job_description:
Python Developer
Full-time/Remote

Responsibilities
As a Python Developer, you will be a key member of our collaborative team supporting our federal client. You will work cross-functionally in an Agile environment to develop an application using Python with a focus on the Django framework.

Must be able to understand data ingests in an AWS Cloud environment. Create data pipelines and works for ingestion of content into a large repository. Create public RESTful APIs. Work with backend and frontend code. Mentor peers and other developers in Python/Django design and development techniques. Participate in stand-ups, design/requirements meetings, code reviews, and internal technology sessions. Provide ideas for innovation in development, performance improvements, process improvement, and testing. Work independently on development of code and creation of unit tests.

Must be flexible, able to work in a highly collaborative environment, juggle multiple tasks at once, and work independently and collaboratively as needed. Must have superior interpersonal skills and strong communication skills.

To be successful, a candidate should have the following skillset:
• 5+ years of solid Python and Django development experience
• Experience with ETL processes to ingest, transform and save content obtained from multiple data sources
• Experience with data workflows and data pipelines with documents, video and audio
• Excellent communication skills
• Experience with JSON-based APIs
• Experience with Microservices
• Experience with JavaScript and JQuery
• Experience with Enterprise Search engines, such as Solr or Elasticsearch
• Agile Development (Scrum) experience
• Experience with developing and deploying to the AWS Cloud
• Experience creating CI/CD pipelines for deployment
Other Requirements
• The right candidate will have a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university with a major in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or other related scientific or technical discipline.
• The nature of being a federal contractor is that the client gets to regulate a few aspects:
• The person for this role must be authorized to work in the United States; preferably a US Citizen or Permanent Resident per our Federal client requirement.
• This person must also be able to pass a Public Trust background check/clearance required by the Federal client.
• This position is open to US-based candidates only; candidates must reside in one of the following states: Washington, D.C., Virginia, Maryland, Pennsylvania, Texas, North Carolina, Georgia, Tennessee, Rhode Island, New Mexico, Wisconsin, or Florida. If you do not reside in one of the following states, Artemis does offer relocation assistance.
• The role will require a pre-employment background and credit check in addition to any applicable client clearance.

Our Company + Your Future
Artemis Consulting is an IT Services and Management company that supports a variety of government agencies in their goals of providing transparency and in making their services easier to access using leading-edge and open-source technologies. In supporting their digital transformation journeys, our collaborative teams are focus on creating modern applications through the use of innovative technologies and methods. We are a growing company looking for motivated individuals who are focused on career growth and adding value to our team. We believe in diversity, equity, inclusion, work-life balance, and offer competitive salaries with comprehensive benefits. If you're passionate about bettering our world through the development of systems in support of government agency missions, we would love to have you join our Artemis team

Remote Life
Here at Artemis, we are building teams that collaborate effectively across time zones while developing products that support the greater good of our client's mission towards transparency and obtainability. You will be empowered to propose ideas and improve products supporting our government clients' missions, all while working from home.

Artemis Consulting is an equal opportunity employer, committed to diversity and inclusion. All qualified candidates will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to disability, race, color, religious creed, national origin, sexual orientation/gender identity, or age.

Artemis Consulting utilizes e-Verify to check employment authorization.
EEO/AA/F/M/Vet/Disabled.

Qualifications: Must be able to understand data ingests in an AWS Cloud environment
Must be flexible, able to work in a highly collaborative environment, juggle multiple tasks at once, and work independently and collaboratively as needed
Must have superior interpersonal skills and strong communication skills
To be successful, a candidate should have the following skillset:
5+ years of solid Python and Django development experience
Experience with ETL processes to ingest, transform and save content obtained from multiple data sources
Experience with data workflows and data pipelines with documents, video and audio
Excellent communication skills
Experience with JSON-based APIs
Experience with Microservices
Experience with JavaScript and JQuery
Experience with Enterprise Search engines, such as Solr or Elasticsearch
Agile Development (Scrum) experience
Experience with developing and deploying to the AWS Cloud
Experience creating CI/CD pipelines for deployment

The right candidate will have a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university with a major in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or other related scientific or technical discipline
The nature of being a federal contractor is that the client gets to regulate a few aspects:
The person for this role must be authorized to work in the United States; preferably a US Citizen or Permanent Resident per our Federal client requirement
This person must also be able to pass a Public Trust background check/clearance required by the Federal client

This position is open to US-based candidates only; candidates must reside in one of the following states: Washington, D.C., Virginia, Maryland, Pennsylvania, Texas, North Carolina, Georgia, Tennessee, Rhode Island, New Mexico, Wisconsin, or Florida
The role will require a pre-employment background and credit check in addition to any applicable client clearance
Responsibilities: As a Python Developer, you will be a key member of our collaborative team supporting our federal client
You will work cross-functionally in an Agile environment to develop an application using Python with a focus on the Django framework
Create data pipelines and works for ingestion of content into a large repository
Create public RESTful APIs
Work with backend and frontend code
Mentor peers and other developers in Python/Django design and development techniques
Participate in stand-ups, design/requirements meetings, code reviews, and internal technology sessions
Provide ideas for innovation in development, performance improvements, process improvement, and testing
Work independently on development of code and creation of unit tests

Position : Python developer with AWS and Angular
Location : Houston TX, (Day 1 Onsite )
Duration : 12+Months Contract
Client : ExxonMobil LTIMINDTREE
Rate :$75hr/c2c

Job Description-
Writing effective, scalable code
Developing back-end components to improve responsiveness and overall performance
Integrating user-facing elements into applications
Job brief
We are looking for a Python Developer to join our engineering team and help us develop and maintain various software products.
Python Developer responsibilities include writing and testing code, debugging programs and integrating applications with third-party web services. To be successful in this role, you should have experience using server-side logic and work well in a team.
Ultimately, you'll build highly responsive web applications that align with our business needs.
Responsibilities
Write effective, scalable code
Develop back-end components to improve responsiveness and overall performance
Integrate user-facing elements into applications
Test and debug programs
Improve functionality of existing systems
Implement security and data protection solutions
Assess and prioritize feature requests
Coordinate with internal teams to understand user requirements and provide technical solutions
Requirements and skills
Work experience as a Python Developer
python is a mandatory skillset with data manipulation libraries i.e numpy & pandas. Azure is a good to have along with C#
Expertise in at least one popular Python framework (like Django, Flask or Pyramid)
Knowledge of object-relational mapping (ORM)
Familiarity with front-end technologies (like JavaScript and HTML5)
Team spirit
Good problem-solving skills
BSc in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field
Must have- Good in python concepts & logics and good experience in AWS, SQL

data.job_description: Position : Python Developer Location : TX (Hybrid)Contract:-6+monthsJob Description : Total Experience as a AWS cloud infrastructure Engineer: Total Experience With Cloud Infra deployments using Terraform : Total Experience With OLTP databases such as MySQL and PostgreSQL: Total Experience With Python applications : Total Experience With ETL tools such as Matillion or Apache Airflow: Must to Have Experience in AWS cloud infrastructure deployments using a config management tool such as Terraform. Experience in working with OLTP databases such as MySQL and PostgreSQL. Experience in developing Python applications for ETL processes, using Git for version control, automated testing using pytest or an equivalent testing library and the use of a CI tool such as Concourse or Jenkins for CI/CD. Experience in managing a data warehouse on an OLAP database solution such as AWS Redshift or Snowflake, knowledge on how to structure the data within such tools in a way that is conducive to analytics. Experience in working with ETL tools such as Matillion or Apache Airflow. Server administration experience in Tableau (this is NOT equivalent to experience creating dashboards on Tableau), knowledge in setting up and maintaining Tableau servers on AWS EC2 instances with multi-node clusters. Experience in containerizing applications using Docker and orchestration of containers using Docker Compose or Kubernetes. Knowledge on analyzing data in heterogenous data sources and inferring transformation and loading mechanisms for source data into analytics databases. Nice to have: Knowledge in building dashboards on Tableu Data science experience using libraries such as pandas, Jupyter Notebooks experience Experience in managing servers using Chef ReactJS/AngularJS experience Experience in developing RESTful API web applications using Python Flask/NodeJS.

Job Title: Python Developer

Duration: 6+ months (W2-Contract to hire)

Work Documents - USC, GC, GC EAD, H4 EAD OR CPT

Location: Dallas, TX OR NJ or NY

( Hybrid Working Model )

Required Skills/Experience:
• BS/BA degree or equivalent experience.
• Experience in at least one programming language, preferably Python including data interchange format, ex. JSON / XML.
• Experience in Django Rest Framework, Ansible, JavaScript, CI/CD pipeline, Rest APIs, React JS, Celery.
• Experience working in Microsoft SQL Server or any other RDBMS.
• Ability to dive into complex problems to troubleshoot and implement functional solutions.
• Provide technical expertise throughout the software lifecycle including design, implementation, and delivery.
• Understanding cloud, virtualization, APIs, and modern software languages.
• Experience with developing frameworks that help increase developer efficiency, release velocity, code health and technical standards.
• Advanced experience working with database, windows/unix/linux environments, large scale software development, security software development.
• Understanding or have experience with agile and lean philosophies.
• Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
• Excellent written and verbal communication.
• Ability to collaborate with different roles to achieve common goals.
• Experience with Git or other VCS.
• Experience with standard CI/CD tools including Jenkins/Bamboo/TeamCity and Spinnaker is advantageous.
• Good to have some working experience on Saltstack.
